page.title: 03MANOR HOUSES
page.content:
Buzzacott house is a listed building and is mainly 17th century but part of it dates back to 1615. It is now a guest house with many attractions and amenities in the grounds which are open to the public.
St John's Well at Coulsworthy is mineral spring water which was bottled and sold in the 1920- 1930's. At present it is available in the restaurant at Coulsworthy House and the owners are hoping to re-open the bottling plant and sell it commercially.
Tattiscombe Manor in, what is now, Trentishoe parish is mentioned in the Domesday Book. Trentishoe Manor is comparatively modern.
